bibl.title: Letter from Otis O. Benson to Jan H. Tillisch, February 27, 1948

div1.p: Benson is fairly certain that the aerial photographs of Cuba that Hench wants are available. He says the photos of foreign areas are classified and must be cleared, but thinks it can be done in a minimum of three weeks.

div1.head: Letter from Otis O. Benson to Jan H. Tillisch, February 27, 1948
div1.opener:
27 February 1948
Dr. Jan H. Tillisch
Clinical Section
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Jan:
div1.p:
After checking with our photographic people, I learned that they are
fairly certain there is coverage for the area Dr. Hench wants. However,
to find the photograph or photographs which are specifically needed it
will be necessary for them to have the charts Dr. Hench enclosed in his
letter to you. All photographs on file here of foreign areas are classi-
fied and must be cleared by G-2 and in this case the Cuban Embassy.
This will take a minimum of three weeks. I am told that this will
probably be cleared without unnecessary difficulty. I believe it will
save time if Dr. Hench will request the photographs directly.
Incidentally, there is a charge of 50 cents a print -- to cover the area
wanted may require one or several of these photographs, as the areas are
covered by numerous photographs. Dr. Hench should address his request
for the photographs and their clearance to the Photographic Records and
Services Division, Office of the Air Adjutant General, Department of the
Air Force, Washington 25, D. C.

I sincerely hope it turns out that we have what you want and that
the time factor will be satisfactory.
I look forward to seeing you when you are in Washington.

closer.signed:
OTIS O. BENSON, JR.
Colonel, Medical Corps
Chief, Medical Research Division
Office of The Air Surgeon
